intro: Bulbostylis juncoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf bulbostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Poaceae. It is a small, grass-like plant that typically grows in wet or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in swampy or seasonally flooded areas. Due to its habitat preferences, it plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and supporting local biodiversity.
